channel.title: Opening Visual Effects For YouTube
channel.description:
I'm a moderator and I have to say I don't know if this is the right board.
Anyway, I have the drawing talent of an infant and I know nothing about animating so I need help from people far more artistically talented than myself.
If you're able to do this and if you are willing I would be most grateful. I essentially want a complex, appealing, and red .:P
I'm not artistic but I imagine something like this would take quite a bit of skill and time. The Droid Maxx's boot screen is a good example. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xNDCVtDSu0E
Reply if you can help me out :confused:

item.title: Opening Visual Effects For YouTube
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:2, topic:545612”]Create the wrap image in Photoshop and split it into sections. Using the video editor in Photoshop animate it to the way you want it.
There are a piss load of photoshop animation tutorials that you can follow.

That’s how I use to do it and got managed to get okay results.[/quote]

If I could draw that would be helpful but unfortunately I can’t draw so photoshop will do me no good. I simply don’t have the artistic ability. 'Tis why I’m requesting

Read full topic

item.title: Opening Visual Effects For YouTube
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Create the wrap image in Photoshop and split it into sections. Using the video editor in Photoshop animate it to the way you want it.
There are a piss load of photoshop animation tutorials that you can follow.

That’s how I use to do it and got managed to get okay results.

Read full topic
